analysis: The documents in this cluster primarily concern directives and orders issued by the President or War Department during and immediately after the Civil War and a later document concerning the Philippine Archipelago. They cover a range of topics including allegiance oaths, military drafts, trade regulations, treatment of foreign powers' property, military governance, suspension of habeas corpus, establishment of military districts in former Confederate states, approval of sentences for conspirators in the Lincoln assassination, the establishment and operation of the Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands, and quarantine procedures in the Philippines. The sentiment is generally formal and authoritative, reflecting the official nature of the documents.
title: Civil War Era Directives and Post-War Governance
